actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to increase incentives for savings and investment.

summary.text: Savings and Investment Act-Increases the investment credit, under the Internal Revenue Code, from 7 to 15 percent. Increases the variance from 20 to 40 percent, under the provisions of Internal Revenue Code relating to class lives for purposes of depreciation. Permits a 12-month amortization of pollution control facilities. Permits an income tax exclusion for capital gains from securities sales or exchanges under $1000. Allows an increased tax credit of up to $200 for an amount equal to 10 percent of qualified savings deposits during a taxable year.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to increase incentives for savings and investment.
